alert.note: Alert for Western Grant; Western Mineral; Western Pendleton (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 09 at 11:49AM EST until March 10 at 2:00PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 2 PM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of up to two inches and ice accumulations of a trace to one tenth of an inch. * WHERE...Portions of western Maryland, western Virginia and eastern West Virginia. * WHEN...From 4 AM to 2 PM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...From Mineral County southward, ice accumulations are most likely above 2500 feet. To the north, much of Garrett County should see some icing. As the system exits on Friday night, additional snow showers are possible through Saturday morning. This will be accompanied by blustery northwesterly winds gusting up to 40 to 45 mph.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.

area.areaDesc: Western Grant; Western Mineral; Western Pendleton
